page.title: 01The Area's General Geography
page.content:
****************************
The relief of the land is relatively flat, with a maximum height of 95m above sea level. There are no major valleys. There is one major river which runs through the area and it is the Skerne. In addition, there is a small Woodham Burn which runs through the north western part of the area. A large proportion of the land cover is given over to farmland which is on fairly flat ground. The remaining land is given over to settlement which is found in the south west part of the area. In this region, there are also three schools. Crossing north south through the area is the A1(M) motorway and a major railway linking Newcastle and London.
